trans-unit.source: Specifies the context keyword for a class or member.
This class cannot be inherited.
By default, the Help keyword for a class is given by the <xref:System.Type.FullName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property value.
For members, the Help keyword is given by the full name of the type that declared the property, plus the property name itself.
For example, consider the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button?displayProperty=fullName> control.

The class keyword is "System.Windows.Forms.Button", but the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property keyword is "System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text", because the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is declared on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control?displayProperty=fullName> class, rather than the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button?displayProperty=fullName> class itself; the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button?displayProperty=fullName> class inherits the property.

By contrast, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button.DialogResult%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is declared on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button?displayProperty=fullName> class, so its keyword is "System.Windows.Forms.Button.DialogResult".
When the Help system gets the keywords, it will first look at <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute>.
At the class level, it will return the string specified by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute>.
This will not be used for members of the type in question, which will still reflect the declaring type's actual full name, plus the member name.
This attribute supports strongly typed classes that have associated common documentation but distinct Help IDs.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref> class.
The Help keyword value.
keyword is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref> class from the given type.
The Help keyword will be set to the <xref:System.Type.FullName%2A> property of `t`.
The type from which the Help keyword will be taken.
t is `null`.
Represents the default value for <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref>.
This field is read-only.
The default value for <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute> is `null`.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref> instances are equal.
Two instances of a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute> are equal if their Help keywords are equal.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref>.

`true` if the specified <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.HelpKeywordAttribute"></xref>.
Gets the Help keyword supplied by this attribute.
The Help keyword supplied by this attribute.
Determines whether the Help keyword is `null`.
`true` if the Help keyword is `null`; otherwise, `false`.
